programme.title: The Engagement Ring
programme.desc: A long-lost engagement ring still divides childhood sweethearts who are now in their golden years. Now, her daughter and his nephew meet and find that their attraction is hindered by the old feud. Starring Patricia Heaton.

programme.title: The Big Fix
programme.desc: A family on the brink of collapse find themselves trapped in each other's bodies. "Freaky Friday" goes to church, in this heart-felt family comedy.

programme.title: Transsiberian
programme.desc: One of those legendary train trips that people used to dream about taking, the Transsiberian Express has probably seen better days. An American couple, Roy (Woody Harrelson) and Jessie (Emily Mortimer), decide to return home the long way from their recent sojourn in Peking and meet another couple from the West, Carlos (Eduardo Noriega) and Abby (Kate Mara), with whom they quickly form that tenuous bond that often unites fellow travelers away from home. When Roy gets separated from the train at a stopover, Jessie begins to realize that their compatriots aren't exactly who or what they seem to be. But the real dangers of their unforgettable trip have only begun to surface Russian cops (Ben Kingsley plays one), mobsters, and locals are still to come.

programme.title: Stone
programme.desc: Academy-Award®-winner Robert De Niro and Academy-Award®-nominee Edward Norton deliver powerful performances as a seasoned corrections official and a scheming inmate whose lives become dangerously intertwined in this thought-provoking drama.

programme.title: In Hell
programme.desc: Kyle LeBlanc (Jean-Claude Van Damme) is an honorable citizen who winds up incarcerated in Russia after he takes revenge on the man who murdered his wife, resulting in the killer's death. Unfortunately for Kyle, he is assigned to a prison that is renowned for its violence. Controlled by a corrupt and sadistic warden, the facility regularly holds brutal fights between inmates. In order to survive in the prison, Kyle must participate in the battles, even as he attempts to retain his humanity.`

programme.title: Swing Expedition with Chris Como
programme.desc: "A journey to explore golf's leading teachers, players and influencers. Chris Como visits PGA National Golf Club and shows how his student, Jamie Lovemark, has come back from multiple injuries and swing changes. Jamie also demonstrates workouts that can help prevent future injuries."

programme.title: School Of Golf (Instructional)
programme.desc: "Instructor Martin Hall provides tips and drills utilizing an in-studio golf simulator. Martin Hall shares the wisdom he's learned from some of the greatest Masters Champions. Learn three big swing keys from Jack Nicklaus, how to hit it like Arnold Palmer with the help of two tees, and numerous drills Tiger Woods did at an early age."

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.desc: "As the field dwindles, players must negotiate the limbo wall to secure immunity. One competitor commits a costly mental mistake which could lead to disaster. A surprise development brings Super Immunity back into the discussion. Hosts: Tom Abbott, Paige Mackenzie. From the Barefoot Resort and Golf in Myrtle Beach, SC."

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.desc: "The remaining contestants look for the right combination to unlock success with their short games. From PGA National Resort and Spa in Palm Beach Gardens, Florida."

programme.title: Swing Expedition with Chris Como
programme.desc: "A journey to explore golf's leading teachers, players and influencers. Chris Como travels to Lake Mary, Fla. to learn from Mike Bender, the 2009 PGA Teacher of the Year and long-time coach for 2007 Masters Champion Zach Johnson."

programme.title: School Of Golf (Instructional)
programme.desc: "Instructor Martin Hall provides tips and drills utilizing an in-studio golf simulator. Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal teach how to stick it close with iron shots. Martin reveals what to learn from great ball strikers such as six-time Major Champion Nick Faldo and 2018 Honda Classic winner Justin Thomas. Also, learn how laser tag, a hula hoop, and a slot machine can improve iron play."

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.desc: "Players must choose teams at breakfast, and one captain bases selections on personal relationships. Meanwhile, another player makes no friends in a move that turns the entire series on an emotional edge. Hosts: Tom Abbott, Paige Mackenzie. From Barefoot Resort and Golf in Myrtle Beach, SC."

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.desc: "The Bear Trap Games The final three contestants take on a stretch of holes that includes the infamous Bear Trap to determine who will play for the title of Big Break Champion."

programme.title: Swing Expedition with Chris Como
programme.desc: "A journey to explore golf's leading teachers, players and influencers. Chris Como visits with Terry Rowles and reveals how he teaches the golf swing based on specific body types. Terry demonstrates how the proper grip and backswing are decided based upon an individual's body measurements."

programme.title: School Of Golf (Instructional)
programme.desc: "Instructor Martin Hall provides tips and drills utilizing an in-studio golf simulator. Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal discuss the role of the hands and how to use them through all parts of the swing. Learn what Tom Watson says is his number one swing key, and how household items such as a coat hanger can improve ball striking."

programme.title: The Big Break

programme.title: Hunting Land Man - Hunting Land Man - "The Grind"

We bounce around in this one going from taking the kids to school, handling business at the office, showing an amazing property, and finally getting some time to hunt. programme.desc: We add some major power to our 1.6 liter Honda Civic Rally Car. Then put on the dyno for some professional tuning to give us all the power we need to hit the course.

programme.desc: In a Blue Crab battle, Challenger Akaboshi Sou, a favorite cook of the Royal Family takes on Iron Chef Michiba.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen - Day Three
programme.desc: Frustrated after another lackluster dinner service, Chef Ramsay shares some of his experiences running a successful restaurant while setting the third night's competition.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen - Day Four
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay ends the battle of the sexes, and "Hell's Kitchen" breaks new ground when the teams cook for an especially demanding group: children.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Hot Potato Cafe
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay travels to Philadelphia, Pennsylvania to visit Hot Potato Cafe. He finds an owner sapped of passion who has created a toxic environment filled with negativity.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Le Bistro
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay drops by a French eatery and discovers that he and the head chef have similar culinary training. However, the chef is in denial about the poor quality of his restaurant's food.

programme.title: Green Sauce and Tomatillos: Mexican Vine Dining
programme.desc: Rick takes us out to the garden to discover just what a tomatillo is and isn't (hint–it's not very closely related to a tomato), with tips on how to grow tomatillos, what to look for when buying them and how to judge their ripeness.

programme.title: Fruit, Aguas, Ices & Paletas: The Ripe Stuff
programme.desc: Fruit is everywhere in Mexico–sweet, colorful and refreshing. And it's sold ripe, so the lush smell of tropical fruit is always in the air.

programme.title: Iron Chef - France Special Part 2
programme.desc: Chairman Takeshi Kaga travels to battle the great chefs of France. Witness as Iron Chef Hiroyuki Sakai and Iron Chef Koumei Nakamura battle to defend the honor of Iron Chef and the Gourmet Academy.

programme.title: Iron Chef - Prawn
programme.desc: Chen must face a man who was his father's trusted apprentice. When they both prepare his father's signature dish, who will win?

programme.title: The Chefs' Line - Lebanese
programme.desc: Maeve O'Meara visits the kitchen of Nour. Maeve and the chefs' line reminisce about the week and delve into delicious new dishes, including a duck shawarma and camel sambusak, bombalaska, and a modern fatteh.

programme.title: The Chefs' Line - Thai
programme.desc: Apprentice chef Peppi from Thai restaurant Easy Tiger goes up against four passionate home cooks. Witness the competition, camaraderie, and spectacular skills of these talented cooks and chefs. Who will make it to the end of the chefs' line?

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati spends a day with one of Oaxaca's best-known chefs and owner of Casa Oaxaca, Alex Ruiz.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati meets with women chefs, business owners and leaders of society, exploring the role of women in Oaxaca.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati travels to the small town of Teotitlan de Valle to meet with one of the best cooks in Oaxaca.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati shows how to get the most out of one day in the city of Oaxaca.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati visits the town of San Martin Tilcajete to meet Maria and Jacobo at their famous art school.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati takes us on an in-depth exploration of all things mole.

programme.title: Basic Versus Baller: Travel at Any Cost
programme.desc: In the state capital of Texas, Marko and Alex see what Austin has to offer. An eclectic city known for its music and cuisine, the guys brave the Texas heat and check out what keeps Austin weird.

programme.title: Basic Versus Baller: Travel at Any Cost
programme.desc: Green juice, avocado toast, and surfers galore. Marko and Alex are back home in Los Angeles to explore their town, staycation style. From downtown to the beach, the guys do everything fun under the sun in the city of angels.

programme.title: All The Pizza
programme.desc: Meet Carlo, a self-described pizza addict looking to answer the age-old question, "Why pizza?"

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's United Kingdom
programme.desc: Venturing out with local Newquay fisherman Phil, Luke helps catch spiny spider crabs and cooks up Asian-inspired crab cakes. Then, Luke meets Cornwall's "best" pasty maker, before discovering what it takes to produce caviar that's fit for the Queen.

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's United Kingdom
programme.desc: In Cardiff, Luke meets an artisan bread maker who delivers bread to homes by bicycle. Next, Luke heads to the seaside and stumbles across the Hang Fire Smokehouse pop-up restaurant. Then, he travels to Wentwood Reservoir for a spot of fly fishing.

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's United Kingdom
programme.desc: In the hills of the Lake District, Luke cooks with a cut of the delicious local sheep. He meets Annette Gibbons, whose passion for Cumbrian food earned her an Order of the British Empire. Later, Luke is taught the secrets of Haaf net fishing.

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's United Kingdom
programme.desc: Between the waters of Bute and the mainland, Luke chases succulent langoustines and meets a seaweed who is making the most of the island's natural resources. Later, he visits Mount Stuart and creates a Scottish whiskey dessert.

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's United Kingdom
programme.desc: In Edinburgh, Luke discovers the country's traditional cuisine and checks out the Scots Monument and Edinburgh Castle. He learns how to make the Scottish delicacy, haggis and is entertained by the Duchess of Northumberland in her poisonous garden.

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's United Kingdom
programme.desc: Luke discovers a chef's paradise at Vallum Farm, where he cooks a mouth-watering pork belly. Then, he visits the historic Hadrian's Wall and prepares a meal fit for a Roman emperor. Later, Luke explores Manchester's busy restaurant strip, Curry Mile.

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's United Kingdom
programme.desc: Luke reflects on his travels and discoveries before catching up with friend Brett Graham, co-owner of Michelin-starred The Ledbury. Later, Luke meets Viking Ole who shares his secrets to smoking the perfect salmon.

programme.title: Dinner Party People
programme.desc: Host Lizzy Mathis joins House Father Jamari as they make Cheeseburger Egg Rolls, Vegan Spring Rolls, Glitter Rice Paper Flowers, and some fabulous cocktails for his LGBTQ+ buffet and dance party. Get your heels on and bring your appetite!

programme.desc: The Bon Appétit Test Kitchen teaches you all the recipes and cooking techniques you need to know.

programme.desc: Experts give tutorials on fundamental cooking skills tied to a variety of ingredients in a given category!

programme.desc: Join Chef Adrienne Cheatham for a deep dive into everything you'd ever need to know about working with your ingredients.

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.desc: Grilled calamari smoked turkey fajitas grilled scallops and watermelon salsa cold gazpacho.

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: Chef Robert Jewell shows us vegetarian and meat recipes in this challenge using pecans and peppers.

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: Combine oats and okra into a single dish. What do you get? Chef Robert Jewell has a delicious idea!

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Lisa combines fruit with savory flavors.

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Vietnamese expert Lisa Nguyen shows us recipes that are fit for a royal dinner party.

programme.title: Holiday Eatz
programme.desc: Star quarterback chef-host Kimberly Lallouz has a Game Day menu that will turn the tailgate party into a touchdown.

programme.title: Spencer And Robert's Game Day Buffet
programme.desc: Spencer Watts and Robert Jewell invite the lads over to watch the big game, and take on easy-to-make eats, including chicken wings, pulled pork, and a few surprises.

programme.title: Bonacini's Italy
programme.desc: Michael prepares classic dishes inspired by the central Italian region, Le Marche.

programme.title: Edible Road Show
programme.desc: The heritage of Icelandic cuisine on the shores of Lake Winnipeg.

programme.title: Edible Road Show
programme.desc: Carlo rides the range, herds cattle and partakes in campfire cookout.

programme.title: Cook Like a Chef
programme.desc: Chef Caroline McCann-Bizjak shares tips for preparing herbs.

programme.title: Cook Like a Chef
programme.desc: Chef Rodriguez shares tips for cooking vegetables.

programme.title: The Latin Kitchen
programme.desc: Avocados are a staple in Mexican cuisine.

programme.title: The Latin Kitchen
programme.desc: Juan Pablo Gonzalez inspires us with corn recipes from his home country.

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.desc: Smoked wings jerked wings suicide hot wings asparagus cucumber salad.

programme.title: One-Skillet Dinners
programme.desc: When most people think of dishes like lasagna and jambalaya, they think of labor-intensive weekend meals. In this episode, however, we develop versions that could be prepared on a busy weeknight.

programme.title: Meat and Potatoes
programme.desc: What's for Sunday dinner? Around many American tables, it's meat and potatoes. Beef brisket is a good choice and a nice change from pot roast or beef stew. Although inexpensive and not so difficult to prepare, brisket does pose some challenges to the cook.

programme.title: Even More Italian Classics
programme.desc: Just when we think we've become familiar with every Italian dish under the sun, we're pleasantly surprised to come across one we've somehow overlooked-Spaghetti with Marinara Sauce.

programme.title: Chocolate Delights
programme.desc: Bridget and Julia uncover the secrets to making Foolproof All-Butter Pie Dough and Chocolate Cream Pie, and tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a tasting of cocoa powder. Finally, test cook Elle Simone makes Julia a decadent Dark Chocolate Fudge Sauce.

programme.title: The Perfect Cake
programme.desc: Bridget and Julia make the perfect Gingerbread Layer Cake and Keith Makes Sticky Toffee Pudding Cakes.

programme.title: The Perfect Cookie
programme.desc: Test cook Dan Souza makes Julia a festive recipe for Easy Holiday Sugar Cookies. Equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his top pick for parchment paper, and gadget critic Lisa McManus reviews silicone baking mats. Test cook Lan Lam then makes Bridget the Best Lemon Bars.

programme.title: Holiday Feast
programme.desc: Test cook Ashley Moore shows host Bridget Lancaster how to make a Crumb-Crusted Rack of Lamb that is perfect for the holidays. Next, equipment expert Adam Ried shows host Julia Collin Davison his top picks of electric knives. Finally, test cook Christie Morrison shows Julia how to make a showstopping Brussels Sprout Gratin.

programme.title: Pub-Style Favorites, Revisited
programme.desc: Hosts Julia Collin Davison and Bridget Lancaster uncover the secrets to making the ultimate Pub-Style Steak and Ale Pie at home. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his top pick for knife blocks. Finally, test cook Keith Dresser makes Bridget perfect Boston Brown Bread.

programme.title: Soup for Dinner
programme.desc: Test cook Dan Souza and host Julia Collin Davison make Chicken Bouillabaisse, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a tasting of cinnamon, and then Julia and Bridget uncover the secrets to Avgolemono.

programme.title: How to Roast Everything
programme.desc: Bridget and Julia teach viewers how to make the ultimate Beef Tenderloin with Smoky Potatoes and Persillade Relish. Tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a turkey tasting. Gadget critic Lisa McManus reviews fat separators, and then test cook Dan Souza makes Turkey Breast en Cocotte with Pan Gravy.

programme.title: Roast Beef and Potatoes
programme.desc: Test cook Natalie Estrada reveals the secrets to making a foolproof Classic Roast Beef Tenderloin with host Bridget Lancaster. Next, host Julia Collin Davison discovers equipment expert Adam Ried's top pick of tongs. Finally, test cook Lawman Johnson shows Julia how to make perfect Lyonnaise Potatoes.

programme.title: Regional Italian-American Favorites
programme.desc: Test cook Bryan Roof makes host Julia Collin Davison a New York classic, Prosciutto Bread. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Bridget Lancaster to a tasting of provolone cheese. Finally, test cook Ashley Moore shows Bridget how to make the easiest-ever Drop Meatballs.

programme.title: Italian Comfort Food Classics
programme.desc: Test cook Bryan Roof cooks host Julia Collin Davison a surprising Italian classic: Chicago Thin-Crust Pizza with Homemade Italian Sausage. Next, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Bridget Lancaster to a live taste test of jarred pasta sauce. Finally, test cook Lawman Johnson and host Bridget reveal the secrets to a perfect Pasta Fagioli.

programme.title: Arroz con Pollo and Sour Orange Pie
programme.desc: Hosts Bridget Lancaster and Julia Collin Davison prepare a comfort food classic: Arroz con Pollo. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a tasting of store-bought whipped topping. And finally, test cook Christie Morrison reveals the steps to make a Florida favorite, Sour Orange Pie.

programme.title: Pork and Pierogi
programme.desc: Hosts Julia Collin Davison and Bridget Lancaster prepare a show-stopping special occasion Cider-Braised Pork Roast. Next, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a sauerkraut tasting. Finally, test cook Bryan Roof teaches host Julia Collin Davison the secrets to tackling authentic Pittsburgh-style Potato-Cheddar Pierogi at home.

programme.title: Regional Italian-American Favorites
programme.desc: Test cook Bryan Roof makes host Julia Collin Davison a New York classic, Prosciutto Bread. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Bridget Lancaster to a tasting of provolone cheese. Finally, test cook Ashley Moore shows Bridget how to make the easiest-ever Drop Meatballs.

programme.title: Fish Tacos and Steak Fajitas
programme.desc: Test cook Bryan Roof and host Bridget Lancaster prepare a Southern California classic, Smoked Fish Tacos. Next, equipment expert Adam Ried shows host Julia Collin Davison his top pick of chimney starters. Finally, test cook Christie Morrison makes Julia Grilled Steak Fajitas.

programme.title: Ciao Italia - Legumes for Health
programme.desc: Often lost in the shadow of Tuscany, much is hidden in Umbria, the “Green Jewel” of Italy, especially this region's wonderful recipes. Mary Ann changes all that when she prepares Lentils and Leeks with Sausage, a meal in a pot and one to remember. And if you possibly have room for more, she shows you how simple it is to prepare Roasted Chickpeas.

programme.title: Ciao Italia - Comfort Food
programme.desc: The region of Emilia Romagna is the “go to” region for some of the best comfort food in Italy. Mary Ann prepares an unforgettable Balsamic Vinegar Glazed Pork Butt that would soothe the soul of anyone. And on the off chance that more comfort is needed, she turns her talents to creating her Nona Galasso's “take another slice” Swiss Chard and Potato Pie.

programme.title: A Taste of History - Nothing Grows on Exuma
programme.desc: After the Revolutionary War, British Loyalists, who were no longer welcome in America, sailed to Exuma, an island in the Bahamas with their slaves. Soon after the loyalists returned to England, leaving their slaves. The descendants of these slaves have kept the rich culture alive on the island. Chef Walter prepares the recipes of Exuma: Conch Salad, Conch Fritters, Fish Fry and a Guava Duff.

programme.title: A Taste of History - Freedom Trail
programme.desc: Boston is the site of so many important events that led up to the American Revolution, including the Boston Massacre, the Boston Tea Party, and the oldest existing American war ship, the USS Constitution. Visitors today can follow the Freedom Trail in downtown Boston on a walking tour through American history.

programme.title: A Taste of History - Longfellow's Poem
programme.desc: Everyone knows of Henry Longfellow's poem, “The Midnight Ride of Paul Revere.” The poem made an obscure silversmith into an enduring Revolutionary legend, but how much do we actually know of the events that took place at Old North Church and at the Battle of Lexington. In this episode, historian Dr. William Fowler brings the famous poem to life, and we also visit Paul Revere's house.

programme.title: A Taste of History - John Adams
programme.desc: John Adams, 2nd President, is arguably one of our most important founding fathers, but he feared history would not remember him. In this episode, we visit Adams' birthplace home in Quincy, MA, and we bring Adams back to life in Independence Hall, to experience why he was so important to America's birth.

programme.title: Michael Chiarello's Napa - Dinner Duet
programme.desc: Some foods are sexy because of their texture or flavor, and some are sexy because of how they're served. These are the foods we'd cook for a very important evening. A lush seafood stew with scallops, shrimp, mussels, clams and Pernod, a whole-leaf Caesar salad made to be eaten with your fingers, and a silken Caramel Panna Cotta. We'll visit Greystone, one of the oldest buildings in the valley.

programme.title: Michael Chiarello's Napa - Late Night Dining
programme.desc: We take you along to the biggest charity event in the Napa Valley and then come back home to make some late-night favorites: a home-style onion soup, a spicy spaghetti Amatriciana, and dried-fruit compote flavored with Sambuca.

programme.title: Michael Chiarello's Napa - Winter Favorites
programme.desc: When the temperature drops, foods should deepen in flavor. These are the dishes we make when it's cold outside. A Chicken Bolognaise that's lower in fat than the traditional version, Fennel Roasted Vegetables, and a cheesecake made with flavorful mascarpone.

programme.title: Michael Chiarello's Napa - Pesto Perfecto
programme.desc: Pesto is much more than basil and pine nuts. Learn the technique and make tomato pesto (with our infamous flowerpot chicken and bruschetta), walnut pesto and even your own pesto with the flavors you choose. Meet some olive growers who make olive oil in the Napa Valley.

programme.title: Michael Chiarello's Napa - Panzanella
programme.desc: Italians make this bread and vegetable salad in the summer with fresh tomatoes and garlic. We show how to make it all year long, with a springtime asparagus panzanella, a classic summer version, and with veal medallions to serve as a main course. We'll tour Main Street, St. Helena, and see some of the valley's most charming stores and restaurants.

programme.title: Chefs A'Field: Kids On The Farm - Hill Country Venison: Chef David Bull, Austin, TX.
programme.desc: Hill Country Venison: Chef David Bull, Austin, TX. In Austin, Texas, there is a man named Bull who, contrary to his name, is no cowpoke----instead it's deer that strikes his fancy, and fine dining is his game. The chef and his sons get a close look at the Cervidae as they frolic through Texas' Hill Country.

programme.title: Chefs A'Field: Kids On The Farm - Winter Bay Scallops: Chef Michel Nischan, Westport, CT.
programme.desc: Winter Bay Scallops: Chef Michel Nischan, Westport, CT. In this episode the chef plunges in for one of nature's perfect offerings,: the bay scallop, with its pink and orange shell and translucent, sweet meat. Breaking the ice, we pull up the sought after delicacy,: in-shell scallops that taste of green apples and the sea.

programme.title: Chefs A'Field: Kids On The Farm - Ice Cream From A Cow: Chef Bill Telepan, New York
programme.desc: Ice Cream From A Cow: Chef Bill Telepan, New York. The chef and daughter head out on a milking adventure in upstate New York to a dairy farm that is: "hopelessly out of date, and proud of it," says the dairyman. Here they milk and make milk products the same way they did it three generations ago, in small batches, delivered at peak freshness, pasteurized and hormone-free.

programme.title: Chefs A'Field: Kids On The Farm - Wild Foraging: Chef Jason Wilson, Seattle
programme.desc: Wild Foraging: Chef Jason Wilson, Seattle. In true Seattle style, the chef straps on his boots to trek deep into the woods around of the Puget Sound in search of wild mushrooms maple blossoms, stinging nettles, fiddlehead ferns, fragrant truffles, berries and a menagerie of exotic herbs, berries, and fungi mushrooms offerings from the wild.

programme.title: Cooking with Nick Stellino - Breakfast Favorites
programme.desc: Nick prepares French toast with butter braised strawberries in a cassis sugar, matzo brei, a breakfast burrito and kir royale.

programme.title: Cooking with Nick Stellino - Southern Comfort
programme.desc: Nick Stellino cooks chicken Milanese, Southern style biscuits and gravy and lobster macaroni and cheese.

programme.title: Heritage
programme.desc: We meet Chef Jimmy Bannos Jr., two time nominee for the James Beard Foundation Award for Rising Star Chef, and fourth generation restaurateur. His concept, The Purple Pig, is fueled by timeless flavors that reflect his Greek and Italian roots.

programme.title: Field, Forest, Feast
programme.desc: Forager Chef Alan Bergo gathers and cooks the most delicious wild food ingredients of the springtime. Recipes include flank steak with ramp salsa verde and steamed nettles and a spring shoot salad with bacon and pheasant back mushrooms.

programme.title: Field, Forest, Feast
programme.desc: Forager Chef Alan Bergo gathers delicious wild food ingredients of the summer including wild greens, chanterelles mushrooms and wild blueberries. Recipes include chicken of the woods gnocchi, walleye with chanterelles and a blueberry dessert.

programme.title: Field, Forest, Feast
programme.desc: Forager Chef Alan Bergo gathers the most delicious wild food ingredients of late summer and autumn including a variety of wild mushrooms and berries, Jerusalem artichokes, wild spices and herbs.

programme.title: The Grill Trip
programme.desc: Chef and food-stylist Megan Mitchell takes you on an epic road trip to the country's most gorgeous locations and grills it up completely outdoors. We'll follow her as she explores and creates a meal that captures the spirit of the spot she's landed.

programme.title: Getting Amongst
programme.desc: Shane and Ben explore the Netherlands by bike and discover an old church that was converted into a skatepark. They arrive in The Hague in time for “Go Skate Day”, where they meet Tessa who takes them kitesurfing.

programme.title: Getting Amongst
programme.desc: Shane and Ben meet up in Panama City to explore the hub of the Americas. Along the way, they visit the non-profit “Give and Surf” on Bastimentos Island and explore the “The Plastic Village” in Bocas Town.

programme.title: Basic Versus Baller: Travel at Any Cost
programme.desc: In Genoa, the brothers cruise the streets, while one of them gets a taste for the lavish lifestyle of Italy's Northwestern port. They take in all the views: heads in the clouds on a high-flying funicular, and just above water at the local aquarium.

programme.title: Basic Versus Baller: Travel at Any Cost
programme.desc: Marko and Alex head to Lyon, France, a city known for its gastronomy and endless history.

programme.title: Basic Versus Baller: Travel at Any Cost
programme.desc: Marko and Alex find themselves in the prosperous and pristine city of Geneva, Switzerland. A city nestled alongside a beautiful glacier-fed lake, the guys will explore the riches Geneva has to offer.

programme.title: Basic Versus Baller: Travel at Any Cost
programme.desc: Soaking in the beauty and elegance of the French Riviera, Marko and Alex are in Nice to enjoy the simplicity and splendor of this seaside city.

programme.title: Basic Versus Baller: Travel at Any Cost
programme.desc: Ocean breeze, turquoise waters and a whole lot of amazing cuisine. Marko and Alex are soaking up that island life in Okinawa, Japan and learning what makes it so unique.

programme.title: Basic Versus Baller: Travel at Any Cost
programme.desc: ​Welcome to the buzzing capital of Taiwan. A rich blend of cultures, old meets new in this thriving metropolis of Taipei. Marko and Alex eat their way through the city, experiencing some unique traditions along the way.

programme.title: Basic Versus Baller: Travel at Any Cost
programme.desc: Sandwiched between Thailand, Vietnam, and Cambodia, Laos is a destination often overlooked by tourists. Marko and Alex are uncovering the hidden gem of Vientiane, the capital city, to see what goes on in this sleepy town beside the Mekong River.

programme.title: Special Delivery - Cambodia: Water Filters Delivery
programme.desc: Host Khai Saharom takes on a special delivery – sponsoring and bringing water filters to a rural village to help combat and solve the problem. The journey promises to be eventful as Khai must himself drive the truck carrying the filters.

programme.title: Special Delivery - Vietnam: Cow Delivery
programme.desc: Host Greta Georges is in Vietnam on a special delivery mission for World Vision, a humanitarian organization dedicated to tackling the root causes of poverty.

programme.title: Special Delivery - Sri Lanka: Soccer Boots Delivery
programme.desc: Host Pei Fen lugs her special delivery of boots onto a train – for the long ride from Colombo to Kilinochchi – eager to help the girls put the tragic past behind and look forward to a brighter future.

programme.title: Special Delivery - Nepal: School Reconstruction
programme.desc: Host Paul Foster hooks up with his Nepalese friends to undertake a tough, dangerous and exhilarating 14 hour drive up the mountains in a special delivery of masonry that will help rebuild schools and bring the children back into the classroom.

programme.title: Special Delivery - Vietnam: Postal Service
programme.desc: Host Daniel Hutchinson joins the postman in delivering personal packages to the families but not before embarking on an arduous journey to where the tribes are situated.

programme.title: Special Delivery - Laos: Medical Supplies Delivery
programme.desc: Host Carla Dunareanu partners with “Bridging the Gap Mekong Trust” to travel upriver to a remote village in her special delivery of mosquito-nets and precious medical supplies.

programme.title: Special Delivery - Malaysia: Tools for a Better Life
programme.desc: Host Paul Foster journeys up the Tembeling River and into the primeval forest in search of just such a community from the Batek tribe. His mission, to deliver rice and clothes to the Batek to help them cope as their way of life is threatened by modernity.

programme.title: Special Delivery - Indonesia: Horse Mobile Library
programme.desc: Host Khai Saharom joins Ridwan Sururi in this endearing and noble effort to bring books to the villagers. On his journey, he meets Lasmi, a very shy young autistic girl whom Ridwan has successfully taught to read.

programme.title: Special Delivery - Thailand: A Life Changing Climb
programme.desc: n this episode, Host Carla Dunareanu travels to Bangkok to meet an extraordinary father-son pair.

programme.title: Special Delivery - The Philippines: Emergency Grab and Go Bags
programme.desc: Host Pei Fen volunteers with Mercy Relief for a long trek into a hilly and remote Cagayan region, bringing with her “Emergency Grab and Go Bags” that could well be a matter of life and death for the indigenous communities in the next typhoon strike.

programme.title: Special Delivery - East Malaysia: Securing Tomorrow
programme.desc: Our host, Paul Foster travels to Silk Island, Sabah – to deliver materials that will complete a sea cucumber ranch. And in doing so, becomes completely enamoured with these enchanting gypsies of the sea.

programme.title: Special Delivery - The Philippines: From War to Hope
programme.desc: For months, the battle raged between pro-ISIS rebels and government forces. When the sounds of war finally subsided, large swathes of Marawi are in ruins and its displaced population are left to pick up the pieces.

programme.title: On Safari - The Outpost Lodge
programme.desc: Sika's Safari Adventure starts in the Northern Kruger National Park in the Limpopo Province, where The Outpost Lodge rests high on a hill encompassed by stunning vistas of the Luvuvhu River.

programme.title: On Safari - Jamala Madikwe
programme.desc: JAMALA MADIKWE, Sika's second Safari destination has been awarded “Most Romantic Lodge in South Africa” and is set around a Game-rich waterhole in the malaria-free Madikwe Game Reserve.

programme.title: On Safari - Thanda Safari
programme.desc: THANDA, meaning ‘Love' in isiZulu, is a proud member of “The Leading Hotels of the World” and known for exclusive close-up encounters with Africa's magnificent Big Five.

programme.desc: Charlie Luxton heads to East Sussex, where paramedic Steve and his partner Hannah are self-building a straw-bale house in a beautiful woodland glade.

programme.title: Building the Dream - Cumbria
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton heads to Cumbria, where Andy and Amy have set their hearts on self-building a huge four-bedroom home with a farmhouse feel. But is the job too big for them?

programme.title: My Fair Wedding: Mad Men Bride

programme.title: My Fair Wedding: Under The Sea Bride
programme.desc: Bride Diamond wants to be under the sea at her wedding, even if that means wearing a scuba suit! David Tutera takes her outlandish ideas and creates an amazing fantasy wedding, fit for a mermaid princess.

programme.desc: Bride Sno E. wants a Snow White wedding. But her wedding gown is an old beauty pageant dress, and her venue is a small back yard. David Tutera decides to bring Sno E.'s storybook fantasy to life.

programme.desc: Bride-to-be Erika wants a Mexican themed wedding, but her future in-laws are insisting she honor Samoan tradition. David must disarm a pushy mother-in-law and negotiate a cease-fire.

programme.title: My Fair Wedding: Mermaid Bride

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The chefs must create fusion dishes by mixing cuisines from two different countries. The winner has a dinner date with Chef Ramsay and their family while the losers participate in "moving day".

programme.desc: Chef Ramsay spends a week in Los Angeles in hopes of refining Burger Kitchen's disappointing menu and subpar service.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares

programme.desc: In Norwalk, Ohio, Chef Ramsay encounters the inflexible owner of Mill Street Bistro.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Located in Indiana, J. Willy's Bar and Grille is deep in debt. When Chef Ramsay arrives, he challenges the owners to use fresh ingredients, but the inexperienced chefs get overwhelmed.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Located in Bellmore, New York, The Mixing Bowl faces an influx of competition and barely has customers. Chef Ramsay strives to correct problems with the restaurant's appearance and menu.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: When Chef Ramsay returns to Finn McCool's, The Olde Stone Mill, The Mixing Bowl, Dillon's, Campania's and Peter's, he finds restaurants saved from the brink of disaster.

programme.title: Mansion Lions Hotel
programme.desc: Award-winning hotelier Alex Polizzi meets the flamboyant owner of the three-star, 110-bedroom Mansion Lions Hotel in Eastbourne. But her plan to transform it into the best three-star hotel in Eastbourne soon comes crashing down to earth...

programme.title: The White Hart
programme.desc: The Hotel Inspector is called to The White Hart, a 15th century haunted hotel in Hertfordshire. Can Alex convince the owners to dump the ghosts and ghouls before the business becomes dead and buried?

programme.desc: Alex Polizzi's visit to the Eden Lodge in Falmouth leaves her all at sea.

programme.title: Green Man
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi's trip to Wembley proves there's more than one way to run a failing business.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: The designers participate in the always-anticipated Unconventional Materials Challenge of the season. This time around, the designers are tasked with making a garment entirely from items that are found in Dylan's Candy Bar.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.sub-title: Welcome Back (or not) to the Runway
programme.desc: The designers are broken into teams of two, where they are tasked to design a red carpet look to be worn at the Emmys. Each team is assigned a client to design for, and this client is one of several past contestants on Project Runway. Each outfit is also inspired by a different color Lexus, which serves as their mode of transportation in the beginning of this episode.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: For the Michael Kors Challenge, the designers are tasked with making an outfit for a woman on the go—something chic and stylish but wearable enough to last throughout the entire day. Also, the designers are left in a state of confusion as two of their fellow competitors abruptly decide to leave Project Runway.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.sub-title: It's My Way on the Runway
programme.desc: In the Marie Claire Challenge, the designers are once again split off into teams to design a fashion capsule collection for the new magazine Marie Claire at Work. The teams also must direct a fashion shoot for their collection, which is also part of the criteria they are judged on for this challenge.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: In a challenge for L'Oreal, the designers team up with clients whose friends or loved ones are in desperate need of a makeover. The designers must consult and work with their clients to give them a new and flattering look that is also conducive to their lifestyle.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: For the Lord and Taylor Challenge, the designers receive the opportunity to design a look for a capsule collection that celebrates ten seasons of Project Runway. If chosen as the winner, their look would join the ranks of many former Project Runway designers and winners, and it would be manufactured and sold at Lord and Taylor.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: For this challenge, the designers divided into teams of three, and they must raise their own shopping money by selling t-shirts and other designs on the streets of NYC. Once they have raised their money, they have to design a two-piece fall collection, and one look must include a piece of outerwear.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: For the HP Challenge, the designers must create their own textile and design a look that is representative of their heritage. They are surprised when a member of their family comes for a surprise visit and helps them with their inspiration.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.sub-title: I Get a Kick Out of Fashion
programme.desc: The designers are treated to a show at Radio City Music Hall, where they learn that they will be designing an outfit for the world-famous Rockettes to wear in an upcoming performance.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: For Heidi's challenge, the designers arrive at Babies R Us where they learn that they will be designing an outfit for their youngest clients yet—babies! In a twist of fate, they are also made to take care of “real” babies: dolls that cry when they need to be changed, fed, or burped. And if that wasn't enough, Heidi throws another twist at the designers they also must create a complementary look for the baby's mom to wear.

programme.title: All the Wrong Moves
programme.desc: Sonia and Froy show off their best moves against a team of dance instructors who will stop at nothing to hold onto their car. Matt and Sonia repossess a vehicle from a woman with the world's most vindictive boyfriend. Lou and Froy match muscle, wits with a gang of vicious roadies.

programme.title: Heart Attack Panic
programme.desc: Lou and Sonia are caught in a desperate situation when the owner of their target car is struck by a heart attack. Plus, a repo becomes violent under the watchful eye of the finance company. FSC_OperationRepo_S9E11_HD

programme.title: Sting Operation Blues
programme.desc: Sonia and Lou find themselves in the middle of nowhere in a tooth-and-nail fight with a trio of nerdy stargazers, Froy and Sonia find a cooperative old man to be a hassle after agreeing to let him get his stuff out of his cluttered car, and Lou and Matt go on a repo to interrupt a shady car sale and find themselves caught in the middle of an elaborate police sting operation.

programme.title: Highway To Be Anger-Prone
programme.desc: Froy and Sonia are overwhelmed by a swarm of cheerleaders Matt and Froy interrupt a father and son bonding session gone wrong the team heads to the raceway to prove they still have what it takes.

programme.title: Airplane Arrest
programme.desc: Lou and Froy repo an airplane, but Froy finds himself in handcuffs when Lou takes off. Matt joins Sonia on a repo from a pole dancing studio, but gets more than he bargained for.

programme.title: Secrets and Lies
programme.desc: Matt and Froy repo a car from a girl whose roommate has been keeping two very big secrets. Sonia and Froy's repo from a creepy husband reveals some incriminating evidence to his wife, and when Lou and Sonia can't locate their target car, Lou comes up with a master plan that requires some back-up

programme.title: The Showstopper
programme.desc: While attempting a repo of a "green energy" bio-diesel vehicle, Froy's (Froylan Tercero) lack of knowledge of the vehicle's specialized fuel system sets the bus ablaze... and when his error causes it to explode, he and Matt (Matt Burch) abandon builders/owners Mickie (Michael Q. Schmidt) and Joey (Gino Calabro) in the middle of the desert.

programme.title: Nursery Crime
programme.desc: Sonia and Matt go to a garden center to repo a forklift, but a language barrier causes chaos. Matt and Froy are in danger when Froy refuses to call the cops on a gun-wielding debtor.

programme.title: Call for Help
programme.desc: With the pressure of Froy's legal problems mounting, the team does everything they can to convince him to hire a lawyer. Froy and Matt confront a misogynist frat boy with a dark secret, Sonia and Froy wrangle with a squadron of costumed rally racers, and Lou, Matt, and Froy get the surprise of a lifetime when they're faced with a truck-full of vicious gangsters.

programme.title: The Big Letdown
programme.desc: Froy meets with a lawyer, but his legal troubles are worse than expected. Sonia and Froy confront a debtor who uses a homeless man in his ploy to keep his car. Then, Sonia and Froy discover one debtor's alcoholism is only a farce to cover a bigger secret. And finally, the team's attempt to repo fifteen bikes from a gym is not the morale booster Lou had hoped for.

programme.title: The Waiting Game
programme.desc: While Froy waits on news from his lawyer about his warrant in Texas, he considers taking matters into his own hands. Lou and Froy bust some slick moves in an attempt to wrangle a car from a debtor who is prepared to battle. Then, when one woman behaves like a child, Matt puts her in timeout, but worries he may have gone too far. And finally, Lou, Matt, and Froy take on an jealous husband with deadly aim.

programme.title: Knife Week
programme.desc: Matt and Froy head to Texas to clear Froy's name, but things take a turn for the worse and Froy finds himself in more trouble than he can handle. Back in LA, Lou and Lyndah repo a car from a deceptive charity worker, and Lou is left to protect the girls from two knife wielding debtors who will go to any lengths to keep their vehicles.

programme.title: Think, Adapt and Attack
programme.desc: When a debtor and his friends resort to baseball bats, chaos erupts, and Lou, Lyndah and Sonia fight not only with them, but also with each other. Down in Texas, Matt and Froy wait to clear up Froy's warrant and get in way over their heads working for a local repo team. Meanwhile, Lou decides to re-hire Frankie despite Sonia and Lyndah's objections, but first Lou wants to see how Frankie fares when faced with the temptation in the form of strippers and alcohol.

programme.title: Cement Mixer
programme.desc: Down in Texas, Matt and Froy are staking out a cement mixer, but their repo turns disastrous when an innocent bystander gets showered in concrete. In LA, Frankie takes the reins with an alcoholic debtor, and Lou and Sonia deal with a diva who pushes Sonia to her breaking point.

programme.title: Couple of Yups/Bottled Feelings/A Screw Loose
programme.desc: First, Frankie and Lyndah find themselves in a fancy neighborhood, dealing with a pair of uptight yuppies with well-coordinated clothes and well-coordinated attacks. Then Lyndah goes wild when a truck-driving debtor gets physical with Sonia. And finally, Matt and Froy face down a backwoods Texan with secret ammunition.

programme.title: Mess with Texas
programme.desc: Matt and Froy face incredible odds against a Texas-sized biker gang looking for a beat down, and when bullets fly, it starts to look like they may never come back home. Back in LA, Frankie's wild antics jeopardize a repo and push Lyndah to her breaking point.

programme.title: Frankie'd Up Beyond All Recognition
programme.desc: Matt and Froy set out to repo a truck from a wealthy Texan, but their mission backfires when the Sheriff arrives with a new arrest warrant that will send Froy away for good.

programme.title: Monumental Changes
programme.desc: Lou takes his new guys on their very first repo but, when the debtors attack with chainsaws, Ronnie and Carlos are left to fend for themselves.

programme.title: Adapt, Improvise, and Overcome
programme.desc: Lou plans an elaborate sting operation to infiltrate a cult, but everything goes awry when the new guys aren't prepared and Matt is left picking up the pieces.

programme.title: I'M LIVE: S1 E234
programme.desc: Joining us on this week's I'm LIVE is risking city-pop songwriter nokdu! nokdu made his big debut in 2018 with the single "Say My Name." As a graduate of The Liverpool Institute for Performing Arts, founded by Paul McCartney and Mark Featherstone-Witty, he covers a wide range of genres in his music, ranging from Brit-pop to punk to R&B. Backed up by his academic background, he boasts his outstanding ability not only as a songwriter but also a lyricist, producer, and singer. Also known for his stage manners, he is quickly capturing the ears and souls of countless listeners. Currently, he's taking part in the competition program "Super Band 2." His fantastic performance in the show definitely makes us anticipate his future as a musician. In this episode, nokdu performs "Stay With Me," "Wona," and more to show off the essence of his artistry. Tune in to I'm LIVE and meet this talented artist!

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Josh Blue - The Disabled List
programme.desc: Following his groundbreaking win on NBC's Last Comic Standing in 2006, Josh Blue has risen through the ranks to become a well-established headliner at venues throughout the world.

programme.title: Lee Hardin - Not Quite a Grown-Up
programme.desc: Lee Hardin is a comedian known for making bad decisions and his love for Taco Bell.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Joey Ilo - Just Work With What You Got
programme.desc: Making jokes and being wild and silly had been seen as a weakness for Joey growing up in Wisconsin, but now it's what makes him unique and relatable.

programme.title: Ross Bennett - Comedy! ... for the rest of us
programme.desc: A popular headliner at comedy clubs worldwide, veteran comedian (and btw, he's also a veteran!), Ross Bennett has appeared on The Late Show with David Letterman, and, along with countless other TV appearances.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Jeremy Nunes - Neighborhood Sasq-Watch
programme.desc: Jeremy Nunes has drawn rave reviews from critics for his clever observations, unique storytelling style, and ability to improvise with his audience.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Greg Warren - Fish Sandwich
programme.desc: Greg Warren is a nationally touring headliner and has been featured on Late Night with Seth Meyers, Last Comic Standing, Comedy Central Presents, The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson, BET and CMT. Greg is a fan favorite on the nationally syndicated Bob and Tom Radio Show and can be heard daily on Sirius/XM.

programme.title: Danny Johnson - The Chusky Life
programme.desc: Danny Johnson's hilarious, clean stand-up has entertained audiences in comedy clubs, corporate events, and churches nationwide. Often called a cross between Jerry Seinfeld and Kevin James Danny's show is relatable, engaging, and always hilarious. Danny has starred in numerous TV commercials, Comedy Central's Laugh Riots, Florida's Funniest Comedian semi-finalist, Winner-Carnival Cruise line Comedy Challenge, Finalist in Search for the One Christian Comedy contest, and has had the pleasure of sharing the stage with Chris Rock, Bob Saget, Billy Gardell, Richard Lewis, and a variety of others. Danny has led a dual track career for over a decade achieving success in both corporate America and as a comedian. Blending his unique skill sets led to him publishing his first book, "You Stink and They Know It! A practical guide to nailing your next job interview."

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Kevin Bozeman - Clean and Unfiltered
programme.desc: In 1999, Kevin found himself in the real world with no real job skills and a strong desire to work an hour a day. What to do? Inspired by nights on the couch watching TV comedians, Kevin decided to head over to nearby Madison, WI and try the “Open-Mic Night”. Thirteen years later Kevin is still going on-stage, and he has found the job that fit his requirements. “For an hour a night I'm wildly successful”. With a smooth and clever style, a great smile and a contagious laugh Kevin has been entertaining in clubs and colleges across the country. In 2000 he was the winner of the Midwest region of the HBO “Comedy Competition” and flew to Los Angeles to compete as a finalist. He performed on Comedy Central's “Premium Blend” in 2003, and finished 2nd in the Boston Comedy Competition in 2005. He was a semi-finalist on NBC's “Last Comic Standing” in 2010. This past summer he co-starred in the Indie film “Flat Chested” starring Alicia Witt and Luke Perry. He currently resides in Chicago.

programme.title: Daniel Eachus - A Mild and Skinny Guy
programme.desc: Daniel Eachus talks about weird jobs, strange fears, and how to prank restaurants all through the lens of being the lifelong skinny guy.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Alex Velluto - Thirsty
programme.desc: Alex Velluto is a stand-up comedian and Diet Coke drinker from Salt Lake City, Utah. He has performed at comedy festivals all over the country including the Boston Comedy Festival, Big Sky Comedy Festival, and the Seattle International Comedy Competition. He was named “Best of Fest” at the Golden Spike Comedy Festival and is the winner of the Finger Lakes Comedy Festival in Ithaca, NY. In 2016, Alex was voted “Best Comedian” by City Weekly Magazine. His debut comedy special “Alex Velluto: Spurious” is currently streaming on Amazon.com.

programme.title: Jeff Big Daddy Wayne - Big Daddy Kicks It
programme.desc: Comedian Jeff Wayne was dubbed “Big Daddy” by Billy Crystal and Robin Williams on an HBO Comic Relief show. The moniker has stuck to a guy who's been part of the stand-up comedy scene for a long time. He's toured all over the world, several times in Europe. The Norwegian Newspaper “Sondags B.A.”, described him as having “amazing audience communication, and ferociously funny!”

programme.title: Moody Molavi - Remove Before Flight

programme.title: Karli's Life Box
programme.desc: A longtime favorite of children and adults, and a staple of PBS, "Sesame Street" bridges many cultural and educational gaps with a fun program. Big Bird leads a cast of characters teaching children numbers, colors and the alphabet. Bert and Ernie, Oscar the Grouch and Grover are just a few of the other creatures involved in this show, set on a city street full of valuable learning opportunities.

programme.title: A Change of Art The Litterbug
programme.desc: While painting outdoors, Elinor and her class experiment with natural items that they find after they run out of paint Elinor, Ari and Olive help Mrs. Hippo pick up litter.

programme.title: When You Wish Upon a Cake Make Room for Sonia
programme.desc: Clifford, a 20-foot-tall red dog who loves stories, and his owner, Emily Elizabeth, enjoy new adventures as they explore their island home. Clifford, Emily and their friends all live on Birdwell Island, where they practice good citizenship. Inspired by the scholastic book series by Norman Bridwell, each episode emphasizes social-emotional skills and a curriculum that promotes early literacy and imaginative play.

programme.title: What's at the Center of the Earth? Troglobites! Minerals!
programme.desc: Preschoolers get to hop on board the "Dinosaur Train" to learn about natural science, natural history and paleontology. Each half-hour episode of this series, produced in CGI-animated format by the Jim Henson Company, features Buddy, a preschool-aged Tyrannosaurus Rex, and his adoptive Pteranodon family traveling on a special train to meet all kinds of dinosaurs and explore the world inhabited by these amazing creatures. Also included are live-action segments hosted by paleontologist Scott Sampson.

programme.title: She Is the Moon of Moons Beats of Beijing
programme.desc: The kids learn about China's Moon Festival Honey, a mischievous hamster, settles down in a drum that is to be used for a drum ceremony.

programme.title: Follow That Boat Windmill Monkey
programme.desc: Curious George is a sweet African monkey who can't help but run into trouble. George's friend, "The Man in the Yellow Hat," tries very hard to care for George and is always saving the day. The show's themes are about learning, forgiveness and playful curiosity.

programme.title: Freezin' in the Summer Season Total Eclipse of the Sun
programme.desc: This animated series centers on house cat Fred, a dreamer of the great outdoors. Once his family leaves for the day, Fred becomes Nature Cat and with the help of his animal friends, he embarks on action-packed adventures that allow him to explore the natural world. The series is voiced by comic actors, including "Saturday Night Live" alums Taran Killam (Nature Cat), Kate McKinnon (Squeeks), Bobby Moynihan (Hal) and Kenan Thompson (Ronald). Kate Micucci rounds out the cast as Daisy.
